| roughly 2.1 nm and 6.7 nm, respectively. Pfam = PF00560 Pfam_clan = CL0022
| InterPro = IPR003590 SMART = SM00368 PROSITE = MEROPS = SCOP = 1bnh TCDB = OPM

'Ribonuclease inhibitor (RI)' is a large (~450 residues, ~49 kDa), acidic (pI
~4.7), leucine-rich repeat protein that forms extremely tight complexes with
certain ribonucleases. It is a major cellular protein, comprising ~0.1% of all
cellular protein by weight, and appears to play an important role in regulating
the lifetime of RNA.

RI has a surprisingly high cysteine content (~6.5%, cf. 1.7% in typical
proteins) and is sensitive to oxidation. RI is also rich in leucine (21.5%,
compared to 9% in typical proteins) and commensurately lower in other
hydrophobic residues, esp. valine, isoleucine, methionine, tyrosine, and
phenylalanine.
